items.title: Congress Certifies Trump Election | Balance of Power
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
"Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Former Representatives Cheri Bustos (D) Illinois & Denver Riggleman (R) Virginia shares their thoughts on Congress certifying the 2024 Presidential elections on the same day, four years after Jan. 6, 2021, where an angry mob of rioters interrupted the same proceedings.

Chapters:
00:00:00 - Balance of Power Begins
00:02:08 - Bloomberg’s Mike Dorning on Congress Certifying 2024 Election Results
00:06:30 - Bloomberg’s Peggy Collins on Trump Saying He Will Not Pare Back Tariffs, Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau to Step Down
00:11:20 - Fmr. Rep. Cheri Bustos (D) Illinois on Congress Certifies Trump Election, January 6 Riot, Possible Trump Jan. 6 Pardon
00:20:23 - Bloomberg’s Nathan Dean on Federal Reserve Vice Chair of Supervision, Michael Barr, to Step Down
00:23:44 - Fmr. Rep. Denver Riggleman (R) Virginia on Congress Certifying Presidential Election, Contrast Between ’25 Congress & ’21 Congress Proceedings
00:33:26 - Political Panel on Congress Certifies Trump Presidential Election, Trump & Jan. 6 Possible Pardon, What’s Next for Congress
00:40:31 - Political Panel on Speaker Johnson Vows to Pass Trump’s Legislative Agenda, Senator GOP Invites Trump to Meet
--------

items.title: Russian gas stops flowing to Europe via #ukraine
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: Russian gas stopped flowing to Europe via Ukraine, closing off a route that’s operated for five decades after Kyiv refused to allow any transit that funds Moscow’s war machine.

items.title: Stocks Advance as Nvidia Closes at All-Time High | Bloomberg: The Close 01/06/2025
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Barry Knapp, Ironsides Macroeconomics, Katanga Johnson, Bloomberg News, Tom Fitzgerald, TD Cowen, Michael Zezas, Morgan Stanley, Lucas Shaw, Bloomberg News, Ed Clissold, Ned Davis Research, Michelle Meyer, Mastercard, Mark Milian, Bloomberg News, Mario Cordero, Port of Long Beach, Brian Platt, Bloomberg News, Timothy O’Brien, Bloomberg Opinion.

items.title: Viral ‘Zynfluencers’ Are Fueling a Risky Nicotine Hype Cycle
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Zyn represents success for Philip Morris’ “smokeless” strategy and also a major challenge: How can the company sell cigarette alternatives that aren’t so tempting it gets in trouble for hooking kids? Ellen Huet reports

items.title: Justin Trudeau Quits: What's Next for Canada?
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is resigning after more than nine years leading Canada, bowing to sagging approval numbers and a rebellion within his political party. Here's a look at what comes next for Trudeau and his party.

items.title: New York City hits drivers with congestion pricing toll
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: New York becomes the first major city in the US to implement congestion pricing plan as it joins cities like Stockholm and London in charging drivers a fee to enter high-traffic areas. Bloomberg News' Shaquille Omari shows us the projected impact and why some are pushing back on the measure.

items.title: Kamala Harris Certifies Trump Won the Presidential Election
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Congress certified Donald Trump’s presidential election victory Monday without dispute and with his defeated Democratic opponent Kamala Harris presiding, resuming a ritual of democracy four years after a mob attack on the US Capitol marred the vote count with violence.
Read more: https://trib.al/DBrqIrx

items.title: Africa Unrest: Mozambique continues to be rocked by protests
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Mozambique has been rocked by waves of unrest since a disputed election in October, with security forces accused of killing dozens of protesters
Bloomberg's Matthew Hill explains why https://t.co/PTPRtssqKN

items.title: There's No Place to Hide for Investors, Peters Says
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Greg Peters, PGIM Fixed Income co-CIO, says there's no place for investors to hide as markets face a risk of higher inflation. He's on "Bloomberg Surveillance" sharing his market outlook for 2025.

items.title: I'm Still Angry About Jan. 6, Mulvaney Says
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Former Trump Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney says he's still angry about the January 6 protests. Mulvaney also talks about prospects of those involved being pardoned by Donald Trump. He speaks on "Balance of Power."

items.title: Vanguard Leads ETF Issuers | Bloomberg ETF IQ 01/06/2025
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
"Bloomberg ETF IQ" focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. On the show today, Vident Asset Management President Amrita Nandakumar, Bloomberg's Vildana Hajric, and EntrepreneurShares Founder/CEO/CIO Joel Shulman.

items.title: The impact of tariffs on the dollar
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: The impact of universal tariffs: A) They fund the deficit, but B) They have implications in terms of the risk to global growth. Manus Cranny reports
